intro: Hibbertia cistiflora subsp. rostrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking yellow flowers with prominent, elongated petals. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Hibbertia cistiflora subsp. rostrata is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
